credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Fountain
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
description: Horizontal rectangle. Shown obliquely from one of the statues. The enclosure of the round, probably ovoidal basin is shown at the back. In it rises a rock with four lateral lower ledges, upon which statues stand, Minerva at the front left, Neptune at right. The third visible one may represent Ceres. Upon the rock stands a circular pavilion with a colonnade and a dome, with a figure on top. Dark framing band.
name: Drawing
